title: Luminary Close Look: Ellsworth Kelly—Portrait Drawings
hero_caption: Ellsworth Kelly. Hôtel Saint-Georges, Paris (Self-Portrait), 1948. Collection of the Ellsworth Kelly Studio and Jack Shear. ©️ Ellsworth Kelly Foundation.
short_description:
Luminary are invited to connect with curator Kevin Salatino and explore the exhibition Ellsworth Kelly: Portrait Drawing.

Open exclusively to Luminary members, this event requires advance registration and is limited to 20 participants.
list_description: Luminary are invited to connect with curator Kevin Salatino and explore the exhibition Ellsworth Kelly: Portrait Drawing.
description:
Hear from curator Kevin Salatino as you explore a new side of Ellsworth Kelly (American, 1923–2015), an artist best known for abstraction. The informal depictions of friends and other ad hoc models and expressive self-portraits on view in Ellsworth Kelly: Portrait Drawings have rarely or never been displayed or published and span the entirety of the artist's career, from the mid-1940s to the early 2000s.

Open exclusively to Luminary members, this event requires advance registration and is limited to 20 participants.
